bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Anti-slavery is largely

bibl.note: Transcribed from our own digital image of the original manuscript.

body.head: Anti-slavery is largely
body.p: Anti-slavery is largely due to The South. It may almost be said that Jefferson began it; —he is the originator, in brief, and nine-tenths of the grea leading men of the Southern States (Henry Clay & others) have openly or otherwise affiliated with him. The most ardent & honest opponents of slavery in the U.S. have been Southerners born & raised.
body.transpose: *(Washington, Patrick Henry, Madison, Monroe, John Randolph Henry Clay, and others
body.p: From 1776 to 1832 the stream set steadily & accumulated in the South. Down to the latter period, in Virginia, the opposition to Slavery was stern & determ active. in Virginia. Then commenced the Northern Abolitionist Societies with their extremism & their firebrands then arose Calhoun—
